subject: p19800337
Findings: PA and lateral views of the chest were provided. Vague nodular opacity projecting over the right lower lung represents atelectasis, less likely pneumonia. No large effusion or pneumothorax is seen. The cardiomediastinal silhouette is stable. Imaged osseous structures appear intact. No free air is seen below the right hemidiaphragm.
Impression: Vague nodular opacity projecting over the right lower lung is most likely secondary to atelectasis. Consider repeat radiograph with more optimal inspiratory effort to further assess.
